messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] OP
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/10/02 8:45:33 AM, Ozarkren@ripinternet.com writes: So, at the risk of sounding obtuse, what s OP?   Debi == I read it to mean
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/10/02 8:45:33 AM, Ozarkren@... writes:

<< >So, at the risk of sounding obtuse, what's OP? Debi
==
I read it to mean "original poster" :) But I could be wrong. <g> >>


Good. I didn't know what it was. In the SCA it would be "Order of
Precedence" or "out of period," and I knew it wasn't either of those, so I
just skipped it by.

Sandra

messages.subject: OP
messages.msgSnippet: ... == I read it to mean original poster :) But I could be wrong.  Todd Our HOME page http://rambleman.tripod.com/index.html

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re:Obtuse was  bedtimes/ porn
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/9/02 3:22:11 PM, Dnowens@aol.com writes:  Because it means Dull.  Not sharp.  An
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/9/02 3:22:11 PM, Dnowens@... writes:

<< Obtuse can be a geometry term as in an obtuse angle. >>

Because it means Dull. Not sharp. An acute angle is a sharp angle. An
obtuse angle is all flat-headed and NOT sharp.

messages.msgSnippet: What does this mean? Could someone explain? ~Elissa Cleaveland An unlesson d girl, unschool d, unpractic d; Happy in
messages.messageBody:
<<Are you being deliberately obtuse? >>

What does this mean? Could someone explain?
~Elissa Cleaveland
An unlesson'd girl, unschool'd, unpractic'd;
Happy in this, she is not so old
But she may learn.
W.S. The Merchant of Venice III, ii, 160
